comments:
3.0 RC3
I was running a simple workbench and detaching/docking (I was taking screen
shots of the navigator for some documentation) the navigator view. I think this
was repeated 20 or so times.

Then, while docked I tried to open the context menu, and the following exceptino
occured. I was asked to quit the workbench because of the SWT exception. Not the
funny context menu that appears, no separators.

Created an attachment (id=12605)
log file

Created an attachment (id=12606)
messed up context menu
Nick, Steve...didn't you guys put a fix in for this?

This is actually reproduceable everytime now. Here are the steps:
1. detach the navigator. 
2. in the detached view, open the context menu on a file.
3. re-dock
4. open the context menu on the same file

The exception occurs at this point and I am asked to quit the workbench because
of the SWT exception.
We did.  We must have missed some cases.  Need to look again.

WORKSFORME?  I just tried this in a Navigator with org.eclipse.swt.widgets and 
Color.Java.  I must be missing something.

Duplicated again. As I said this happens ALL the time. If you want to try some
variations, open the context menu *before* tearing-off the view. Then click
around in the detached view opening the context menu on a couple of items. Then
re-attach the view into the workbench window and try to open the context menu
again. Pouff! I've been able to reproduce 100% of the time.

Definitly not a worksforme, I'll show you the steps in the morning.

Downloaded 200406212000 and tried again. The same bug appears. This time it
seemed like I had to detach/attach a couple of times to reproduce. But same
error occurs with the same steps.

Moving to SWT as the stacks show SWTError: Item not removed, from within a
Menu.dispose().

I'm assuming we can ignore all entries in the attached log before Jun 21, 2004
16:08:08.661.  Jean-Michel, if there are other items of interest here, please
file separate bugs.
I've helped Steve reproduce this on his machine. He is happy now.
Jean-Michel, please hammer on this.  Thanks.
*** Bug 67660 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 66716 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Using 200406240010, Package Explorer detached, closed Eclipse after using for
some period of time:

Follow up:  I've been using build 200406242010 for about 8 hours (including
closing and reopening) with no problems.

which was quite frequent for me.
